org.openhab.core.items

Interface GroupFunction

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ArithmeticGroupFunction
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArithmeticGroupFunction.And, ArithmeticGroupFunction.Avg, ArithmeticGroupFunction.Max, ArithmeticGroupFunction.Min, ArithmeticGroupFunction.NAnd, ArithmeticGroupFunction.NOr, ArithmeticGroupFunction.Or, ArithmeticGroupFunction.Sum, GroupFunction.Equality

    public interface GroupFunction
    Group functions are used by active group items to calculate a state for the group out of the states of all its member items.
    Author:
    Kai Kreuzer - Initial contribution

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  GroupFunction.Equality
      This is the default group function that does nothing else than to check if all member items have the same state.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      State calculate(List<Item> items)
      Determines the current state of a group based on a list of items
      State getStateAs(List<Item> items, Class<? extends State> stateClass)
      Calculates the group state and returns it as a state of the requested type.

    • Method Detail

      • calculate

        State calculate(List<Item> items)
        Determines the current state of a group based on a list of items
        Parameters:
        items - the items to calculate a group state for
        Returns:
        the calculated group state

      • getStateAs

        State getStateAs(List<Item> items,
                 Class<? extends State> stateClass)
        Calculates the group state and returns it as a state of the requested type.
        Parameters:
        items - the items to calculate a group state for
        stateClass - the type in which the state should be returned
        Returns:
        the calculated group state of the requested type or null, if type is not supported
